data_maturity_score.evidence: Traditional BI focus with Cognos and UNIX indicates legacy systems, some modern elements with cloud platforms and ETL tools mentioned as nice-to-have, but core practices appear traditional rather than modern data engineering

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 2 indicates developing maturity - has some structured processes and modern tools mentioned, but traditional BI approach with legacy systems like Cognos and UNIX

maturity_signals.evidence: No clear modern data stack adoption signals - focus is on traditional BI tools (Cognos) and legacy systems (UNIX), cloud platforms mentioned only as nice-to-have

scope_creep_score.evidence: Well-defined BI/data engineering role focused on Cognos development, reporting, and visualization - no mixing with data science, ML, DevOps, or other roles

overtime_risk_score.evidence: IBM Consulting role with client delivery focus suggests consulting-style demands, no work-life balance signals mentioned, traditional consulting environment

role_clarity.evidence: Clear responsibilities around Cognos development, BI/DW projects, reporting, and visualization with specific technical requirements outlined

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate risk - well-defined role but consulting environment may have overtime demands, traditional tech stack, and location constraints

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No specific reporting structure mentioned - only mentions working with 'business and technical members of the team' without identifying manager or leadership

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No development practices mentioned - no code review, CI/CD, testing, monitoring, or engineering practices discussed

innovation_signals.evidence: Traditional BI focus with legacy tools (Cognos, UNIX) suggests maintenance of existing systems rather than innovation

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML/AI tools mentioned - role focused on traditional BI tools like Cognos

hiring_urgency.evidence: No hiring timeline, start date, or urgency mentioned in job posting

competition_level.evidence: IBM brand recognition in India, established consulting practice, but onsite location in Pune limits competition to local candidates

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is a large, established enterprise company with global consulting operations

hiring_velocity.evidence: No information about hiring velocity, team expansion, or growth plans mentioned

strength_details: IBM is a stable, established enterprise company with global presence
Clear data engineering role focused on BI and reporting with specific technical requirements
concern_details: No salary, benefits, or compensation information disclosed
Traditional tech stack with legacy tools (Cognos, UNIX) - not modern data engineering
India-based position with no visa sponsorship mentioned
No career growth, learning opportunities, or development paths mentioned
IBM Consulting environment likely has consulting-style overtime demands
best_fit_details: Mid-level data engineers (3+ years) with BI/reporting experience
Candidates seeking stable enterprise role with traditional BI focus
probe_details: Ask about salary range, benefits, and total compensation package
Understand typical work hours and overtime expectations in consulting role
Inquire about career progression and growth opportunities within IBM
Clarify the actual tech stack and modernization plans
leverage_details: Being already located in Pune, India is required and limits candidate pool
summary.overall_assessment: Traditional BI data engineering role at established IBM Consulting practice. Stable enterprise environment with clear technical requirements, but limited growth opportunities and traditional tech stack. Main concerns are lack of compensation transparency, consulting-style demands, and legacy technology focus.
